text: [Music]
hi my name is Matt word and I'm here to
give you an update on autoscaling
autoscaling lets you add new instances
when you need additional capacity or
remove them when you don't and you can
add custom logic which fires in response
to these changes autoscaling will keep
the instance which is either about to be
added when scaling up or about to be
removed when scaling down in a holding
pattern until you explicitly confirm
that the scaling event can continue this
gives you time to inst install or
configure the applications running on
the instance or to pull down logs to S3
and until recently you had to maintain a
collection of worker instances to
respond to these changes via
notifications but today we're making it
easier in two ways firstly you can now
respond to autoscaling events with
Lambda functions via cloudwatch events
your Lambda function will be given all
the information it needs to interact
with the instance and decide what to do
next secondly you can now place the
logic for responding to autoscaling
events on the instance itself s since
you no longer need the notification to
complete the scaling action so two new
features for auto scaling available
today thanks a lot
